pkgmetadata.longdescription: The rock-dkms package contains the ROCK-Kernel-Driver.

use.flag: Checks if ACPI support is enabled in the kernel. Enabling ACPI may enhance multigpu detection with PowerXpress (multigpu laptops), provide more sysfs info, access to ACPI events for laptops, dynamic PCI-e frequency tuning.
Checks if the MMU_NOTIFIER is enabled.
Bypass RDEPENDs check for a kernel package.
Checks kernel config for DirectGMA support.
Pulls in the firmware package containing the latest firmware version.
Checks if kernel config for proper support for PowerXpress, Hybrid Graphics (i.e. IGP and dGPU on laptop).

Fills the IO-LINKS' sysfs interface at /sys/class/kfd/topology/nodes/N/io_links/X/node_to using the NUMA data structure. For more info see https://rocm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ROCm_System_Managment/topo3.html#sysfsclasskfdtopologynodes0iolinks01 https://rocm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ROCm_System_Managment/ROCm-System-Managment.html#io-links

Applies a PREEMPT_RT patch to prevent a kernel hang. This requires the a kernel with the rt patch already applied to complete the other half of the patch. This requirement currently applies to 5.6.x kernel series or earlier.
Checks kernel config for SSG (Solid State Graphics) support.
